entries.title: Winning the Stanley Cup Is More Taxing Than Ever
entries.description: As the NHL playoffs near their conclusion, it’s becoming increasingly clear that teams from low-tax states have a sneaky advantage.

entries.title: Donald Trump Is a Heavyweight With Raucous UFC Crowd
entries.description: The presumptive Republican presidential nominee received a frenzied reception at a fighting event in Newark, N.J., on Saturday night, two days after becoming the first former president ever convicted of a crime.

entries.title: 'Endgame 1944' Review: A Savage Conflict in the East
entries.description: A ferocious military campaign put the Red Army within striking distance of Berlin and Stalin in a position to dictate postwar terms.

entries.title: U.S. Presses Two-Lane Diplomacy on Gaza, Facing Road Bumps in Both
entries.description: The U.S. is seeking to end the war through a cease-fire proposal backed by President Biden, while also joining talks this weekend to reopen the route for aid into Gaza from Egypt.

entries.title: Asics Stock Catches Fire Along With Its Dad Sneakers
entries.description: The 75-year-old Japanese sneaker brand is having a moment. So are its shares.

entries.title: OPEC+ Agrees to Extend Production Cuts in Bid to Boost Oil Prices
entries.description: The deal comes the same day Saudi Arabia launched a share sale for Aramco, yielding billions for the country’s economic transformation.

entries.title: Donald Trump Joins TikTok Years After Trying to Ban the App
entries.description: The Republican presidential candidate posted a 13-second clip of himself at a UFC event Saturday night via the social-media platform.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: It turns out more money does buy more happiness. But there's a "tax" to it.

entries.title: Their Loved Ones Died in Plane Crashes. Now They Fight for Change.
entries.description: The Boeing 737 MAX and Colgan Air accidents have spurred grieving families to push for accountability and safety improvements—with some recent wins.

entries.title: These Accounting Firms Took a Different Approach to Shaking Up Their Structure
entries.description: Forvis acquired the U.S. unit of Mazars and formed a new network with the firm internationally, following plans by peers involving private equity, IPOs and a new employee ownership model.

entries.title: The Champions League Winning Coach Whose Plan Is to Have No Plan
entries.description: Carlo Ancelotti is the only manager in history to lift Europe’s foremost club trophy five times. He achieved those triumphs without any discernible soccer philosophy or signature playing style.

entries.title: Lung Cancer Was a Death Sentence. Now Drugs Are Saving Lives.
entries.description: More patients can fend off the disease for months or years with targeted or immune-boosting drugs, results released this weekend at a top cancer conference showed.

entries.title: Zelensky Says China Is Helping Russia Undermine a Peace Summit on Ukraine
entries.description: Chinese assistance to Russia will only prolong the war, Ukraine’s leader said on a visit to Singapore.

entries.title: Trillion Dollar Shot
entries.description: A new podcast series from The Journal explores how a new class of drugs, led by Ozempic, is transforming bodies, fortunes and industries.

entries.title: Mexicans Poised to Elect First Woman President
entries.description: Voters go to the polls in Mexico as two women face off in an election that will result in the country’s first female head of state.

entries.title: Elon Musk and Jamie Dimon Are Making Peace
entries.description: After years of feuding, the business titans spoke at an exclusive JPMorgan summit, opening the door to the two working together again.

entries.title: In Miami, Jobs Are Plentiful---and You Might Need Two to Afford It
entries.description: The Fed wants strong employment and low inflation. The Florida city shows just how hard it is to attain both at once.

entries.title: We Should All Look as Stylish at 44 as This Corvette
entries.description: Richard Fricke’s 1980 Chevrolet Corvette still looks like when he bought it new over four decades ago—minus the 8-track player.

entries.title: Arts Calendar: Happenings for the Week of June 2
entries.description: Charli XCX drops a club album with ‘Brat,’ live-action ‘Star Wars’ returns with ‘The Acolyte,’  Ishana Night Shyamalan makes her directorial debut with ‘The Watchers’ and more.

entries.title: New York Prosecutor Was First to Charge a Former President. Now He Weighs Seeking to Imprison One.
entries.description: Alvin Bragg, the first Black Manhattan district attorney, campaigned on the promise of enforcing the laws equally among the rich and poor.
